title: order of testexecuting differs from user to user
body:
the testexecution differs from user to user.
both system are completely the same...

_here is an example for user 1:_

```
robert@foo:~/workspace/project$ phpunit --verbose --configuration config/phpunit.xml --coverage-html=doc/coverage-unit/ test/phpunit/unit/
```

results in the following order (shortened):

```
PHPUnit 3.5.0 by Sebastian Bergmann.

test/phpunit/unit/
 smagPropelEntityCacheTest
 unit_cmsGuardSecurityUserTest
 unit_TravelTest
 unit_BookingTypeTest
 unit_sfGuardUserTest
 unit_HotelTest
 unit_ABETest
 unit_CountryInfoTest
 unit_DestinationTest
```

_here is the same for another user:_

```
hudson@foo:~/project$ phpunit --verbose --configuration config/phpunit.xml --coverage-html=doc/coverage-unit/ test/phpunit/unit/
```

results in the following order:

```
PHPUnit 3.5.0 by Sebastian Bergmann.

test/phpunit/unit/
 unit_TravelPolaroidPeerTest
 unit_BugClassificationPeerTest
 unit_BugPeerTest
 unit_ABEMapPeerTest
 unit_TravelShopConfigPeerTest
 unit_TravelTipPeerTest
 unit_PolaroidPeerTest
 unit_TravelBugPeerTest
 unit_SubABEModelPeerTest
```

**how is this possible?**

for all developers the tests are executed in order 1, for our ci user, the tests will be executed in order 2...this results in mysterious test failures...
